comment.author: 46696233@N00
comment._content: This is Hugh L. Willoughby's Pelican: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9500E6DF1131E233A...

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content:
undeadsinatra:

Thanks for the information!  It's confirmed and we'll update the description (8/8/08)

comment.author: 9262493@N06
comment._content: A number of individuals are casually researching Hugh deLaussat Willoughby with varying motivations.  These include one who lives in Hugh's Newport RI house, another who is a local historian at Sewall's Point, FL where Hugh made his summer home, and myself, a cousin several times removed.  Any of us would be pleased to assist you in confirming  to your satisfaction that this is Hugh's Pelican.  I believe the LOC and the SI have several collections with photos and notes on Hugh's work.  I should add that there are more photos in the Newport Historical Society collection and at the Elliot Museum in Stuart, FL.   I am local to DC if it helps, and can be reached at fullerton at comcast dot com.
